channel.title: [VB6] Help
channel.description:
Yesterday, I had started to learn VB6 and my first one was A web browser. After I coded it alot, I tested it then suddenly I got an error: [img]http://img374.imageshack.us/img374/7618/errorjd9.jpg[/img]
I definently don't know how to fix this problem. If anyone can help please reply.

item.title: [VB6] Help
item.dc:creator: @wonderguy6 Doc. Booty
item.description:
@wonderguy6 wrote:

Oh Never mind about making a setup for the app. Just right click and hit send to archive then upload it then post it

Read full topic

item.title: [VB6] Help
item.dc:creator: @Haiku01 Haiku01
item.description:
@Haiku01 wrote:

I can’t find Package and Deployment

Its Soo Easy. But i will provide a very detailed tutorial on it

Step One:
“Start” > All Programs > Microsoft Visual-Studio 6.0 > Tools > Package and Deployment.

Step Two:
Click the “Package” Button and a new menu should come up.

It will ask you to find the .vbp (Visual Basic Project File) when you have found it it will ask to find the .exe. If you cant find it Do not worry. it will ask if you would like to complie it into another exe

Step Three
Now it will ask you a bunch of crap. just keep pressing ok, ok ,ok.

When you have finished the setup go to the folder were you saved it:

Now there should be about 3 Files (or more) and a folder:[/b]

Step Four
When you get them files Zip them.

Right Click > New Archive > Drag all of the files to the archive.

Step Five
Now you can share these files and if all goes well your app has a setup file

Its good to make some Mirrors as some people do not like some of the downloads.

www.rapidshare.com
www.megaupload.com

If you like this tut please sign up to my Programming Forum at: www.lagex.net/forums

Thanks!!!

~wonderguy6!

Read full topic

item.title: [VB6] Help
item.dc:creator: @Haiku01 Haiku01
item.description:
@Haiku01 wrote:

Oh ok thanks. Someone must’ve done that. Also after it said that then it said Out Of Memory and I just fixed it. Thanks wonderguy.

EDIT: Im about to release my webbrowser but wonderguy I used your tutorial but I cant find the wizard to do it.

Read full topic

item.title: [VB6] Help
item.dc:creator: @wonderguy6 Doc. Booty
item.description:
@wonderguy6 wrote:

You dont have a start up LOL.

Go to project > project_1 Properties >

Find were it says form startup. Change that to Your main form (if un nammed by default its Form1)

Read full topic
